intro: Cyrtandra lysiosepala var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated for its attractive foliage and unique floral display. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
